column4: hi all, i have an ibm 300 series server. i have installed ubuntu and brought up eth0, assigned it an IP address etc, however, it when I try to ping another machine on the LAN it says: Reply from "insert IP of the ubuntu server - ie, itself" - Destination Host Unreachable. Can anyone help?
that usually means that you don't have the netmask correct (ie you're on a different ip network)
yes the netmask is working. I have a /29 from my ISP (8 IP addresses) - yes dns is configured, the rest of the LAN is perfect
it's all set up properly
next is routing, maybe you don't have  adefault route
how do I add a default route?
route add default gw <ip of gateway>
i just tried that, it still says host unreachable
can you ping your gateway?
no, that is the problem
what is the output of "route"
it outputs nothing
you have serious issues if it outputs _nothing_
it outputs the standard "Kernel IP routing tables blah blah" but there is actually no IP addresses or routes
and you did: route add default gw <i of gateway>?
yes i did, let me try again
do you have a local network? are you directly connected to you internet source?
i have a local network and an ADSL router that handles the subnet. I just rebooted and now I am getting results from "route" can I pm them to you?
yes
pm me the route output and the output of ifconfig
